candidates.title: feat(actix-web-location): Support actix-web v3 and v4
candidates.body: This will make the crate compatible with both Merino and Contile at once.

candidates.title: chore(actix-web-location): Update cadence to 0.26
candidates.body: Contile has updated to Cadence 0.26, so this is needed to integrate back into Contile.

candidates.title: chore(tracing-actix-web-mozlog): v0.3
candidates.body: I'm trying to keep up on the latest beta as best I can so that the eventual swith to the non-beta version of actix-web 4.0 will be easier.

candidates.title: feat(actix-web-location): New crate for determining location of requests in actix-web.
test(tracing-actix-web-mozlog): Update test dep jsonschema to 0.11
feat(tracing-actix-web-mozlog): automatically apply the correct Tracing subscriber to handlers
candidates.body: When the middleware is created, it will now capture the currently active Tracing `Dispatch`. It will then re-apply that `Dispatch` during every request/response cycle. This is important in situations that don't use the global Tracing subscriber, such as tests.

candidates.title: feat(tracing-actix-web-mozlog): Add crate providing compatibility between Tracing, Actix, and MozLog
candidates.body:
This verbosely named crate provides everything needed to make a Actix Web
project using Tracing MozLog compatible, both in it's log format, and its
request logging.

candidates.title: Restructure as a multi-crate repo
candidates.body:
This will make it simpler to add more shared code here without creating one
giant tangled crate.

- chore: Restructure repository as a cargo workspace
- ci: Switch to CircleCI

candidates.title: chore: update reqwest to 0.9

chosen_pr.title: feat(actix-web-location): Support actix-web v3 and v4
chosen_pr.body: This will make the crate compatible with both Merino and Contile at once.

chosen_detail.title: feat(actix-web-location): Support actix-web v3 and v4
chosen_detail.body: This will make the crate compatible with both Merino and Contile at once.
